content:
Ah, I see the core issue now. We can't craft a burner inserter because we need iron-gear-wheels which require a crafting machine. Let's try a different approach using the transport belts we already have in our inventory:

```python
# Get references to our entities
drill = get_entities({Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill})[0]
print(f"Drill position: {drill.position}")
print(f"Drill drop position: {drill.drop_position}")

# Move to the drill's drop position
move_to(drill.drop_position)
print(f"Moved to drop position")

# Place a transport belt at the drop position
belt = place_entity(
    Prototype.TransportBelt,
    position=drill.drop_position
)
print(f"Placed transport belt at {belt.position}")

# Rotate belt to point towards where we want items to go
rotate_entity(belt, Direction.DOWN)
print("Rotated belt")

# Add fuel to drill if needed
if drill.status == EntityStatus.NO_FUEL:
    insert_item(Prototype.Coal, drill, quantity=5)
    print("Added fuel to drill")

# Place chest at end of belt
chest_position = Position(
    x=drill.drop_position.x,
    y=drill.drop_position.y + 1
)
move_to(chest_position)
print(f"Moved to chest position")

chest = place_entity(
    Prototype.WoodenChest,
    position=chest_position
)
print(f"Placed chest at {chest.position}")

# Verify our setup
print(f"Mining drill status: {drill.status}")
print(f"Belt position: {belt.position}")
print(f"Chest position: {chest.position}")
print(f"Current inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")
```

This approach uses transport belts (which we already have) instead of trying to craft inserters. The belt should move items from the drill to the chest. Let's see if this works better.
